body_html:
Please note, that without credentials you must pass the --no-sign-request option to the cli. So that would look like this

pip install awscli

aws s3 ls s3://datasets.elasticmapreduce/ngrams/books/20090715/eng-1M/1gram/data --region us-east-1 --no-sign-request

This works correctly in both containers.

Is there a way to enable debug logging for the s3 filesystem? It would be useful to look at the actual requests it is making

pip install awscli

body:
Please note, that without credentials you must pass the `--no-sign-request` option to the cli. So that would look like this

```
pip install awscli

aws s3 ls s3://datasets.elasticmapreduce/ngrams/books/20090715/eng-1M/1gram/data --region us-east-1 --no-sign-request
```

This works correctly in both containers. 

Is there a way to enable debug logging for the s3 filesystem? It would be useful to look at the actual requests it is making
